Query: How can I extract a page range / a part of a PDF?

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_12588884: Extract part of file name with multiple sections
au_1195340: Extract a specific pdf from a zip file with lots of pdfs
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_111876: TAG1=( $(basename "${FILES[0]}" | sed 's/_/ /g') )
TAG2=( $(basename "${FILES[$N-1]}" | sed 's/_/ /g') )

range="${TAG1[1]}_${TAG1[2]}${TAG1[3]}_${TAG1[4]}${TAG1[5]}_to_${TAG2[4]}${TAG2[5]}"

echo "$range"
#mergecap -w /mnt/md0/capture/DCN/"$range"_utc.pcap ${FILES[@]}

ul_589620: How can I extract specific part of a file?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_687331: sed 's/.*:\(.\{4\}\).*/\1/' in > out

% cat in
ffmj0010.09o:FFMJ MARKER NAME
ffmj0020.09o:BRMU MARKER NAME
% sed 's/.*:\(.\{4\}\).*/\1/' in > out
% cat out
FFMJ
BRMU

ul_589620: grep -oHnE ":[^,]*:" files* | awk 'BEGIN{FS=":"} {x=$1$2; a[x]=a[x]","$4} END{for(x in a) print a[x]}' | sed 's/^,//'

sed 's/^,//'

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_12588884: Extract part of file name with multiple sections
so_34625953: Is there any way to get the page numbers in a PDF of a search pattern?
ul_589620: How can I extract specific part of a file?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_34625953: pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' -vNAME="My name" \
    'index($0,NAME){printf "%d: %s\n", NR, NAME;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
grep -F -o -e $'\f' -e 'My name' |
awk 'BEGIN{page=1} /\f/{++page;next} 1{printf "%d: %s\n", page, $0;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' \
    '/My[[:space:]]+Name/{printf "%d: %s\n", NR, "My Name";}'

ul_589620: grep -oHnE ":[^,]*:" files* | awk 'BEGIN{FS=":"} {x=$1$2; a[x]=a[x]","$4} END{for(x in a) print a[x]}' | sed 's/^,//'

ul_248237: for f in ./*-uniq.tar.gz
do
printf %s\\n "${f%-*}"   
done

for f in ./*-uniq.tar.gz
do
printf %s\\n "${f:0:-12}"
done
